repnme.cdata!: Chad - Management of the Petroleum Economy Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Chad Management of the
            Petroleum Economy Project were as follows: outcomes were
            unsatisfactory; project sustainability was unlikely;
            institutional development impact was moderate; the Bank
            performance was unsatisfactory; and the Borrower performance
            was unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included: there is
            a need for a proper policy environment and a strong
            political commitment to reform; project preparation teams
            must be ready to question existing institutional
            arrangements even when they seem to benefit from the support
            of several key officials; there is a need for a
            comprehensive approach to develop institutional capacity in
            a sustainable manner; computerization of business processes
            is a complex and challenging undertaking that needs a clear
            strategy and proper planning; finally, the GEEP Project
            illustrates the need to phase policy and institutional
            changes not only for political feasibility reasons but also
            because of the limited absorptive capacity of the public
            service in most developing countries.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Management Response to Investigation Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management Response to the
            Inspection Panel Investigation Report responds to alleged
            claims that the Bank violated policies and procedures in
            regard to the Chad Petroleum and Development and Pipeline
            Project.  Management considered the findings of the Panel
            fully and developed concrete actions to address outstanding
            issues in regards to environmental assessment, economic
            analysis, poverty reduction, and the monitoring and
            supervision of projects. Management believes that the Bank
            has made exceptional efforts to apply its policies and
            procedures and to pursue concretely its mission statement in
            the context of the Chad Petroleum and Development and
            Pipeline Project. Given these actions, Management does not
            feel that, as a result, the Requestors' rights have
            been or will be directly or adversely affected by these
            Projects. Management remains committed to a process of
            regular consultation and disclosure to assure the
            environmental and social soundness of the Projects during implementation.

            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates the
            claims of the Requesters regarding the Request that people
            in the area of the pipeline project have suffered
            environmentally as a result of the project and failures and
            omissions in the design, appraisal and supervision by the

            into the claims at the relevant Project areas. After
            evaluating the situation and the Requesters, it was
            determined that the Requesters are eligible according to
            Bank specifications. The Eligibility Report advises that an
            Investigation in to the matters alleged take place.

repnme.cdata!: Chad - Management of the Petroleum Economy Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management of the Petroleum Economy
            Project aims to help Chad build capacity to implement its
            petroleum revenue management strategy to enable it to
            effectively absorb and allocate expected oil revenue, and
            thus pursue the poverty-reduction objective of petroleum
            resources development. The project consists of five
            components: 1) The strengthening public financial management
            component will support to prepare for a consolidated budget,
            manage budget expenditure, manage treasury and public
            accounting, and develop financial management information
            system. 2) The poverty database and strategy component will
            support activities to develop a poverty database, produce a
            poverty profile, and formulate a participatory strategy for
            poverty reduction. 3) The human resources development
            component will help to improve the competence and quality of
            civil service. 4) The oversight and control component will
            support the said functions mandated by the law on petroleum
            revenue management. 5) The monitoring economic reform and
            coordinating capacity building component will support
            pursuit of macroeconomic stabilization and privatization
            agenda, preparation and negotiation of adjustment programs
            with external partners, and monitoring of, and reporting on,
            the implementation of adjustment programs.

repnme.cdata!: Chad - Management of the Petroleum Economy Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management of the Petroleum Economy
            Project aims to help Chad build capacity to implement its
            petroleum revenue management strategy to enable it to
            effectively absorb and allocate expected oil revenue, and
            thus pursue the poverty-reduction objective of petroleum
            resources development. The project consists of five
            components: 1) The strengthening public financial management
            component will support to prepare for a consolidated budget,
            manage budget expenditure, manage treasury and public
            accounting, and develop financial management information
            system. 2) The poverty database and strategy component will
            support activities to develop a poverty database, produce a
            poverty profile, and formulate a participatory strategy for
            poverty reduction. 3) The human resources development
            component will help to improve the competence and quality of
            civil service. 4) The oversight and control component will
            support the said functions mandated by the law on petroleum
            revenue management. 5) The monitoring economic reform and
            coordinating capacity building component will support
            pursuit of macroeconomic stabilization and privatization
            agenda, preparation and negotiation of adjustment programs
            with external partners, and monitoring of, and reporting on,
            the implementation of adjustment programs.
